title: How to hear my voice better when singing while playing piano - Quora

response.answer_text: Both previous answers are excellent, but I thought I’d throw this out there if you don’t have or can’t afford a mic. Get a pair of earplugs. There are lots to choose from in all price ranges, but for this, just get a cheap pair of the foam ones they sell in the drugstore. First, put both in and sing. Hear all the nuances? Now, if the piano is not loud enough, try it with one earplug in. PS: This is how I warmed up before a gig in the dressing room. If anythings not right, you’ll know quickly.

Try getting a reflective surface right in front of you, should bounce some of the sound off and back to you. This doesn't work for performances, however… Otherwise, play with one hand and close your ear with the other, so you're relying on the vibrations in your head. Starting to Sing: Learn to sing even if you have a bad voice or can't sing in tune. ... Just 3% of people are tone deaf, meaning 97% of people can learn to sing in tune. There is an astonishing lack of resources for people who pass the test and want to start singing. Go to my Profile and you can find all about playing piano material there...
I use my p.a. system when i play and sing. I put headphones on and isolate my vocal track in the headphones. It works quite well,and allows me to monitor my vocals as i rehearse.

Check for a microphone input and use one? My digital piano is a different brand, but it has an input for a mike and a spot to plus in an external speaker. I also have a card slot for recording playing then it can be looped on playback for rehearsing vocals. Look at the owner's manual to see what your keyboard can do.

Try getting a reflective surface right in front of you, should bounce some of the sound off and back to you. This doesn't work for performances, however… Otherwise, play with one hand and close your ear with the other, so you're relying on the vibrations in your head.

Obviously, keep the lid of the piano closed. Also, if you’re just rehearsing, you can sing into a large ceramic or metal bowl. It looks stupid, but you’ll hear yourself much more the way you would sound to an audience.

If you find a way to plug one ear, with an ear plug or a noise cancelling headphone, you will be able to hear yourself and the piano. Not exactly sure how it works but we use it for tuning in band and when we sing for pitch.
